Hadapi Babak Kualifikasi, 18 Atlit Muaythai Jabar Berlatih Keras di Pelatda Subang
01 Nov 2019, 18:08 by Ruslan Efendi


Hadapi Babak Kualifikasi, 18 Atlit Muaythai Jabar Berlatih Keras di Pelatda Subang

KBRN, Subang : Atlit Muaythai Jawa Barat, yang berada di Pemusatan Latihan Daerah (Pelatda) Kabupaten Subang, mulai berlatih keras untuk menghadapi babak Kualifikasi Desember 2019 di Semarang Jawa Tengah.
Sekretaris Umum Pengurus Provinsi Muaythai Jawa Barat Nendi Suryanegara mengatakan, tim pelatih muaythai Jabar memberikan materi dan porsi latihan 2 setengah jam pagi untuk menggenjot fisik para atlit, dan 2 setengah jam sore hari untuk mengasah teknik beladiri muaythai.
"Kami sengaja memberikan materi dan latihan secara khusus bagi 18 atlit yang akan di boyong ke BK di Semarang Jawa Tengah Desember 2019 nanti, karena dengan materi dan porsi latihan yang diberikan tim pelatih kami yakin bisa lolos ke PON 2020 Papua. Dan kami sadar kemampuan para atlit muaythai di beberapa provinsi seperti Banten, DKI Jakarta, Riau, Jateng dan tuan rumah Papau akan menjadi batu sandungan Jabar, untuk meraih target medali emas di PON 2020 Papua," ujar Nendi keoada wartawan di Subang, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Porsi latihan dalam sepekan kata Nendi, tim pelatih memberlakukan 5 hari full, dari Senin sampai dengan Jum'at, sedangkan untuk porsi latihan pada hari Sabtu hanya diberikan latihan berenang. Khusus untuj hari Minggu seluruh atlit diajak refreshing ke Objek Pariwisata Sari Ater, untuk berendam di air panas Sari Ater, sebagai upaya peregangan otot para atlit.
"Tim pelatih, memberikan libur 1 hari dalam sepekan, yakni oada hari Minggu, dan hari libur latihan itu dimanfaatkan untuk peregangan otot para atlit, tim pelatih membawa para atlitnya ke Sari Ater, untuk berendam di air panas, sekaligus refresing menikmati suasana objek wisata alam. Terlebih air panas Sari Ater bagus untuk kesehatan kulit dan tulang para atlit," jelasnya.
Disinggung tentang cuaca di Subang selama para atlit mengikuti pelatda, ditegaskan Nendi, kebetulan cuaca atau suhu udara di Subang, sangat cocok dengan suhu udara di Semarang pada saat BK, begitu juga dengan suhu udara di Jayapura Papau nanti, pada saat PON 2020 mendatang.
"Untuk suhu udara di Subang tidak masalah dan tidak mengganggu para atlit kita, justru Jabar diuntungkan ketika pelatda muaythai dipusatkan di Subang. Dan itu sangat menguntungkan para atlit," tandas Nendi.

Facing the Qualification Round, 18 Athletes of Muaythai Jabar Practice Hard in Pelatda Subang
Nov 01 2019, 18:08 by Ruslan Efendi


Facing the Qualification Round, 18 Athletes of Muaythai Jabar Practice Hard in Pelatda Subang

KBRN, Subang: Athlete Muaythai, West Java, who is in the Regional Training Center (Pelatda) of Subang Regency, began training hard to face the December 2019 Qualification round in Semarang, Central Java.
West Java Muaythai Province General Secretary Nendi Suryanegara said the West Java Muaythai training team provided training materials and portions of exercise for 2 and a half hours in the morning to boost the athletes physically, and 2 and a half hours in the afternoon to hone muaythai martial arts.
"We deliberately provide material and training specifically for 18 athletes who will be invited to BK in Semarang Central Java in December 2019 later, because with the material and portion of training provided by the training team we are confident we can qualify for PON 2020 Papua. And we are aware of the ability of the Muaythai athletes in several provinces such as Banten, DKI Jakarta, Riau, Central Java and host Papau will be a stumbling block for West Java, to achieve the gold medal target at PON 2020 Papua, "Nendi said to reporters in Subang, Friday (11/01/2019) .
The portion of training for a week Nendi said, the team of trainers applies 5 full days, from Monday to Friday, while for the portion of training on Saturday only given swimming training. Specifically for Sunday, all athletes are invited to refresh themselves at Sari Ater Tourism Object, to soak in Sari Ater hot water, as an effort to stretch the muscles of the athletes.
"The training team, giving a day off a week, namely on Sunday, and the training holiday is used to stretch the muscles of the athletes, the training team brings the athletes to Sari Ater, to soak in hot water, as well as refresing to enjoy the atmosphere of natural attractions. "Moreover, Sari Ater hot water is good for the skin and bones of athletes," he explained.
Mentioned about the weather in Subang as long as the athletes followed the platda, stressed Nendi, coincidentally the weather or air temperature in Subang, was very suitable with the temperature in Semarang during BK, as well as the temperature in Jayapura Papau later, at the upcoming PON 2020.
"The air temperature in Subang is not a problem and does not interfere with our athletes, in fact West Java benefited when the Muaythai regional administration was centered in Subang. And it was very beneficial for the athletes," said Nendi.
